content.body: is there a "standard" build flow for proposals?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: is there a "standard" build flow for proposals?

content.body: for `Intl.DurationFormat` I went with a in-tree index.html file which simplifies things on one side but on the other it makes it really hard to do anything since every change to the built spec incurs a merge conflict
content.formatted_body: for Intl.DurationFormat I went with a in-tree index.html file which simplifies things on one side but on the other it makes it really hard to do anything since every change to the built spec incurs a merge conflict

for Intl.DurationFormat I went with a in-tree index.html file which simplifies things on one side but on the other it makes it really hard to do anything since every change to the built spec incurs a merge conflict

content.body: different people do it different ways. personally I really like ecma262's flow. there's an action on PRs which checks that the build works, and there's a seperate action which runs on commits to main which pushes to gh-pages: https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/blob/main/.github/workflows/deploy.yml
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: different people do it different ways. personally I really like ecma262's flow. there's an action on PRs which checks that the build works, and there's a seperate action which runs on commits to main which pushes to gh-pages: https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/blob/main/.github/workflows/deploy.yml

content.body: temporal does the same thing but with some random published github action instead of committing a shell script, if you prefer that: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-temporal/blob/bf85d75e95ad5625c30c647d0d12ac32de127931/.github/workflows/deploy.yml
